thread.title: Highlights: Cards run over Boston College
thread.title_full: Highlights: Cards run over Boston College

author: info@scout.com (Michael McCammon)
title: Highlights: Cards run over Boston College
text:
Louisville improved to 19-4 overall with win at Boston College Michael McCammon 3:48 PM Louisville had four players score in double-figures to lead the Cardinals to a 90-67 win at Boston College 
Donovan Mitchell and Deng Adel each scored 19 points to lead No. 6 Louisville in a 90-67 victory at Boston College on Saturday afternoon. 
Watch the ACC Digital Network highlight package in the video player above. 
Senior Mangok Mathiang and freshman V.J. King also recorded a double-figure outing, scoring 16 and 11 points respectively. The Cardinals connected on 58 percent of their shot attempts, including hitting 6-of-14 beyond the three-point arc, to fuel the team's third straight blowout win. 
The Cardinals converted 14 Boston College turnovers into 23 points and outscored the hosts by 12 in the paint. 
Louisville improved to 19-4 overall and 7-3 in ACC play. 
Up next for the Cardinals is a visit at rival Virginia on Monday evening. Share on Facebook
